reviewText: Fresh from his hilarious Blue Collar Comedy Tour and top-selling film with Jeff Foxworthy, Ron White and Larry the Cable Guy, this is stand-up at its best, filmed at the Grove Theater, Anaheim, California, on January 23rd, 2004.All Bill's stories are family centered, and very real, which is what makes them so funny; every story is something we have either experienced in one way or another, or observed, and as seen through Bill's keen perception and off-beat "I'm just a guy" humor, incredibly funny. It takes a lot to make me chortle out loud, and there are portions I thought I'd choke with laughter on, like his comments on loading the dishwasher and doing the laundry. It's definitely not safe to eat while watching this !The themes are:21 years of marriage, Momma's fixin' to lose her mind, Difference in years, Kid's grow up fast, Father and son moments, Getting old, Vicodinland, Animal Planet, Love scenes and movies, Here's your sign.Bill keeps the language pretty clean, even if some of his stories take place in the bedroom, and his facial expressions are priceless.Great fun through and through, the DVD "extra" is a still photo "gallery", and total running time is 72 minutes.

reviewText: I dont usually watch the blue comedy tour or any comedy station for that matter but a friend gave me a cd of bill engvall and i cracked up....this guy is hilarious!  So it was no surprise when i went to the store, saw this dvd, and immedialtly bought it.  If you love comedy you'll love Bill engvall, he's smart talking and his jokes are side splitting...you cant resist him.  One thing dissapointing tho is that this disk doesnt contain any extra features besides a still gallery which isnt all that good, but it does contain 72 minutes of comedy fun you'll be sure to enjoy.  Buy this disk, you wont be left wonting.

reviewText: Bill wasn't as clean as he normally is. He said stuff like, "You don't give a rat's a-- about anything", and said other mild language words, along with talking about Viagra. I know comedians like to experiment, but pleeeeeease, Bill, your're supposed to be a "everyman".Ok, pushing that aside, a couple nights ago my dad and I were laughing non-stop. We BOTH loved it (except for occasional "adultness")! So, I've made a conclusion: I would reccomend this DVD for anyone over the age of 13, I would also reccomend this for anyone who likes old jokes with new twists (don't worry, there's new material, too), and just LOVES slapstick (he does A LOT of slapstick!!).Bottom line: Check it out and see how you like it!

reviewText: I like this comedian and giggled several times while watching this video. There are some great one liners here although a lot of his shtick about men is clichéd in my opinion. Many of his observations about marriage are accurate though. There's no shortage of married man who possess the exact same life he describes here. His send up of women's "intuition" was absolutely hysterical. That segment alone is the reason why I gave it four stars.

reviewText: Fans of the Blue Collar Comedy Tour will love this Bill Engvall DVD featuring over 72 minutes of nothing but a microphone and the family-themed, side-splitting comedy of this highly successful comedian. With sales of over two million comedy albums to his credit, as well as success with various TV shows and books, Bill Engvall knows how to make people laugh. As one of four members of the highly acclaimed Blue Collar Comedy Tour, Engvall has firmly cemented himself in the comedian's hall of fame...I first saw Bill on The Tonight Show when I was ten years old. He delivered the best stand-up routine I've ever seen, and I still remember much of it word-for-word to this day... Central to the routine was his trademark tagline "Here's your sign" (referring to a "stupid sign" handed out to people who make dumb remarks). Just like his colleague Jeff Foxworthy, Engvall has managed to keep that tagline not only going, but has done so while inventing a hilarious treasure trove of new material. This guy is just plain funny.In the Bill Engvall DVD Here's Your Sign - Live, the cutting edge comic delivers a dynamic performance worthy of his past success. Tackling the issues and themes of family, fatherhood, and marriage, he serves up a number of memorable one-liners and hilarious stories. But what makes Engvall so funny is that his humor is easy to relate to. Most people can identify with the subjects he tackles, and as everyone knows, all great humor has an element of truth in it.Engvall's DVD is good humor, and it's filled with countless stories about his family. Such as the time he took a cross-country trip with his son and unsuspectingly stopped for dinner at a topless steakhouse... You can't make this stuff up, and he delivers anecdote after hilarious anecdote. This is a comic with a bright and shining star, and all connoisseurs of stand-up comedy should assign this to their list of "must see" entertainment...The DVD Report

reviewText: What makes Bill Engvall such a good stand-up comedian is that he is everyman.  His marriage and family oriented routine is something everybody can relate to and empathize with.  His funny stories about married life after 21 years ring true - as are his stories about his teenage kids.  Engvall's monologue is clean enough to remain family oriented but mischievous enough to be funny and edgy.  Call it PG-13 comedy.The only drawback to this DVD is that I'd already heard almost all the jokes in the two Blue Collar Comedy Tour DVD's which feature Engvall, Jeff Foxworthy, Ron White, and Larry the Cable Guy.  But that's okay, because you can laugh at these jokes no matter how many times you hear them.

reviewText: Bill Engvall draws on rich life experiences and finds the hilarious angle on it in a fresh, ironic, wide-eyed way."Men are simple," he says, "Our three basic needs are sleep, eating, and sex." That explains a lot! And he does, revealing the true nature of cunning women - like a cat with a wounded mouse - as they have their way with hapless men.I roared with laughter at his depiction of man at his toughtful-best - staring at a campfire, concentrating hard, poking it with a stick - thinking his deepest philosophical thoughts... how to get sex.Bill delivers his best material, I think, in "Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again" where he also displays some improvisational genius (Dorkfish, Hunting with Your Wife, and others). I highly recommend that DVD as well.
summary: You Can't Make this Stuff Up!

reviewText: We had cracked up during "The Blue Collar Comedy Tour" DVD, but were disappointed with the TV show. This DVD is more along the lines of the former. Very funny stuff, especially if you're married (not that it is sexual, but there are things that married people can definitely relate to). A couple laugh-to-tears, but most are very good, and almost none are lame (i.e., not a dull moment).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Comedy shows are like a bell curve, with an ebb and flow of jokes and stories the listener finds funny.  It is rare to watch or hear a show at the far end where every joke is gut-busting-laughter funny.  More commonly the listener finds about 50% of the jokes laugh-out-loud funny, 25% chuckles, and 25% merely amusing enough to keep your attention.  That's where the Bill Engvall "Here's Your Sign" show resided for me.  Keep in mind though I'm also his target audience for this particular show; older and married with kids. I watched it once alone, then watched it with my wife, enjoying it both times.  She's not a fan of comedy shows, finding most humor inauthentic and rehearsed-to-death, lacking spontaneity.  In contrast she thoroughly enjoyed Bill's show.Foul language doesn't offend me at all, but the absence of it in this show was refreshing.  I'm keeping the video in my watchlist to share with family visitors who are more sensitive to such matters.

reviewerName: Rich King's Breakfast Nook "Gretna is a great...
reviewText: And I saw this DVD three weeks ago. Bill Engvall is simply the funniest human being on planet earth, or any other planet for that matter! He's funnier than Louie Anderson AND Sinbad! The here's your sign bit just makes me laugh until I throw up. I mean, if someone says something stupid, you say, "Here's your sign". That is genius. The only thing that has ever made me laugh that hard was when Kroll ran over a squirrel with his bike and taunted with a Bill Engvall bit. He's all like, "Hey squirrel, this sidewalk doesn't say squirrel crossing, here's your sign." The squirrel bit him and ran away, but it was still funny. You can use Bill Engvall in your daily life. I was interviewing for a fry cook position and the supervisor guy asked where I went to college. I told him, "I'm interviewing to cook fries, I didn't go to college, Here's your sign." He laughed and immediately promoted me to shift manager before I started the job. I now prepare the orders before they go out and I owe that to the cobra kai of comedy, Billy Engvall!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bill Engvall for me is the funniest of the members of the "Blue Collar Tour." He is the first comedian to make me get philosophical since Jackie Mason's witty routines. His descriptions of family life, marriage, & the basic humor in everyday life were remarkably true & funny. I have friends who laughed so hard during his litany of differences between the first year of marriage & the twenty first that they actually had tears in their eyes. Indeed both the wives & husbands appeared to learn from his musings. How often can we say that from a comedy routine?His marriage seems to describe 80% of today's marriages? Guys can be clueless, & do fake incompetance to avoid certain tasks. Lets face it, guys don't really want to make all the decisions {like females would ever let us?} One thing he said is so true that females may find it unnerving? "If it was not for sex they really would be in trouble, even though most would never admit it. Yes, even single males know how to play the game. His 3 basic male needs-food, sex, & sleep are spot on. We have fewer needs. Ladies,  why is that a negative?Maybe, males are more evolved than we get credit for, I'm not sure?He did leave out sports, but I guess we could survive without them?His having to shop for female toiletries with his son shows just how unsettled we males get over such private matters. I remember being 12 like his son & not having "the discretionary gene he described." I embarressd my father in exactly the same situation. Looking back at that semi-innocent age I could laugh heartily at my own past & see how similar guys of all generations really are.The second half was not as good as the first, but the first was so good that it still deserves 4 stars.
